original_title: APIDM launches AI Proficiency for Business Professionals Program
original_body_lines: The Asia Pacific Institute of Digital Marketing (APIDM) officially launched its groundbreaking AI Proficiency for Business Professionals Program at BMICH, Colombo. This initiative marks a milestone in Sri Lanka’s digital transformation journey, empowering leaders, executives, and entrepreneurs to harness AI for business growth, innovation, and responsible leadership.

Unlike technical AI courses, this program is designed to bridge the gap between artificial intelligence and business decision-making, equipping professionals with practical skills to integrate AI into strategy, operations, and day-to-day workflows. It is tailored for non-technical professionals, giving them the confidence and capability to lead AI-driven change within their organizations.

The program has been developed with clear objectives: to equip professionals with a strong understanding of AI concepts and trends, enable effective decision-making through AI-driven insights, enhance productivity and efficiency with AI-powered tools, foster innovation to address business challenges, and ultimately create future-ready leaders who can guide organizations in the AI era.

Adding perspective, Amitha Amarasinghe, Co-founder and CEO of APIDM, said: “At APIDM, our mission has always been to prepare professionals for the future of work. With the launch of this program, we are taking the next big step, enabling Sri Lanka’s workforce to thrive in an AI-driven economy. This initiative is not just about technology adoption; it’s about creating future-ready leaders who can drive meaningful transformation for businesses and society.”

Following this, Shanaka Pramod, Program Director – AI Proficiency for Business Professionals Program, stated: “AI is no longer a distant future, it is the present. Through this program, our goal is to demystify AI for business professionals, empowering them to make better decisions, optimize workflows, and unlock innovation without needing a technical background. It is about giving today’s leaders the fluency they need to guide organizations in the AI-powered era.”
